body:
@mehrdada for review of the Python/Cython portions of the PR. The main addition from https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/16025 is the fork channel registry, and the fixes we discussed to avoid segfaulting when channel API methods are invoked on an already-closed channels.

@sreecha Can you review the epoll1 changes? The overall structure is similar to https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/16025, but now the polling engine additionally maintains a `grpc_fd` registry (when fork support is enabled) and eagerly closes the fds in the child's post-fork handler.

```

      [NEW]    +552 check_neighborhood_for_available_poller(pollset_neighborhood*) [clone .isra.6]        +552  [NEW]
       +33%    +111 fd_orphan                                                                             +111   +33%
```

```
[microbenchmarks] Performance differences noted:
Benchmark                                                                                cpu_time    real_time
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------  ----------  -----------
BM_StreamingPingPong<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/262144/1                    -5%         -5%
BM_StreamingPingPongWithCoalescingApi<MinInProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/32768/2/1  -5%         -5%
BM_UnaryPingPong<InProcess, NoOpMutator, NoOpMutator>/262144/262144                      -7%         -7%
```


> When we last discussed this, we had said that we were going to ensure that the child process had actually shut down grpc -- i.e., that the call to grpc_shutdown() was actually the last one that was needed -- and that if it wasn't successfully shut down, the child would crash. However, I don't see that implemented here.

This will be in a follow-up PR: see https://github.com/grpc/grpc/pull/16318.

```
[trickle] No significant performance differences
```

@sreecha ping?
I will review this by EOD Aug 16th. Want to review the whole PR (not just the epoll changes)
@markdroth Do you still have any concerns about this, after my response to your earlier PR comments?
